results.title: In grave danger of falling food
results.creator_credit: 220 Productions, Julian Russell and Tony Gailey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visionaries”.
Bill Mollison believes that the single most destructive force on the planet is modern agriculture. It is destroying our soils, poisoning our water and producing toxic food. Instead, he has proposed a system of agriculture - permaculture - that uses the principles of Nature itself. He combines hundreds of species, plant and animal, into a fertile, self-regulating ecosystem. These permaculture systems can be applied to the city as well as the country, and can work in any climate.

results.title: In good company
results.brief_description: A recruiting film made to encourage young men to join the Army as officers. Shows the Officers Training School at Portsea in Victoria, the Royal Military College at Duntroon in Canberra and gives an insight into the lifestyle and career opportunities offered by the Army to any young man who wishes both to further his education at a tertiary level as well as seek a challenging and rewarding career as an officer in the Australian Army.

results.brief_description: Role and training in Australian Citizen Military Forces of part-time soldiers important in Australia’s defence; attendance at weekly parades, weekend bivouacs and annual camps where modern weapons, mock-up battles are used to provide realistic battle and trade experience. results.title: In God's hands
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Tom Stern and Zalman King
results.brief_description: In God’s Hands follows three friends and surfers around the world in their quest for the perfect wave. They travel to Madagascar, Mexico, Bali and Hawaii where their training is put to the test when faced with 40 foot waves travelling at 35 miles per hour. Includes stunning water photography by Sonny Miller. Cast includes: Patrick Shane Dorian, Matt George, Matty Liu and Shaun Tomson.

results.title: In God's command
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jerry Krepakevich, Graydon McCrea and Garth Pritchard
results.brief_description: Throughout the history of war there has been the silent presence of the army chaplain, a comforting person in the midst of atrocities, offering spiritual support and material comfort. ‘In God’s command’ offers an intimate portrait of one such chaplain, Captain Mark Sargent, army officer, Roman Catholic priest and chaplain to the soldiers of the First Battalion; Princess Patricia’s Canadian light infantry, stationed in the former Yugoslavia. The viewer follows Sargent as he ministers soldiers and civilians, arranging Mass, celebrating a baptism, and performs other priestly duties under the most trying conditions with conviction, compassion and humor. Narrated by military historian Gywnne Dyer.

results.title: In fear of every dawn [Magnetic soundtrack]
results.brief_description: Western propaganda presenting life on the Eastern side of the ‘Berlin Wall’. Filmed from the Western side of the border, the film records activities on the Eastern side and provides an anti-communist interpretation and commentary. Shows locals carrying out daily activities; armed guards patrolling the border; watch-towers and concealed observation areas; propaganda billboards; ‘indoctrinated’ youths recruited as guards and frontier police; the ‘forcible’ removal of families from their ancestral homes into detention centres; and endless footage of barbed wire and uniformed personnel.

results.title: In dreams
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Stephen Woolley and Neil Jordan
results.brief_description: Claire (Annette Bening), a children’s book illustrator, lives in a large, rustic New England home in idyllic Massachusetts with her daughter, Rebecca, and husband, Paul (Aidan Quinn), an airline-pilot. At the same time a serial killer threatens the safety of young girls in the community, Claire begins experiencing horrible and nightmarish dreams. The fabric of her dreams not only resembles her illustration work but also the terrible events occurring in the local community. In a truly unnerving twist, it’s revealed that Claire’s unconscious is possessed by the killer. As reality and the dream world collapse, tragedy, violence and confusion ensues. Confined to a mental institution and treated by the ineffectual Doctor Silverman (Stephen Rea), Claire - under the influence of Vivian Thompson (Robert Downey Jr.) - escapes and faces her maligned alterego head on. In a splendid closing montage of water imagery, Claire ultimately finds harmony, peace and tranquillity. By acclaimed director Neil Jordan, “In Dreams” is a dark and unnerving film that gives full and rich exploration to the theme of the unconscious as a pool of mixed desires and impulses. Also features excellent cinematography by Darius Khondji.

results.title: In dense traffic
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and John Edwards
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “How to Drive”.
Town driving demands great powers of concentration, road observation, the ability to react quickly to changing situations, and considerable driving skill. Patience and restraint play an important part in dense traffic driving, allowing safe distance around our vehicle as a ‘cushion of air’ and giving greater visibility of traffic movement ahead.

results.title: In country
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Norman Jewison and Richard Roth
results.brief_description: At seventeen, Samantha Hughes of Hopewell, Kentucky is pretty, energetic, headstrong and curious; curious about the father she never knew, and curious about the war that took him away - the war nobody wants to remember. Bruce Willis plays a reclusive vet in this story of a family’s struggle to heal the wounds of Vietnam. This film captures both the horror of battle and the disillusionment of a young soldier who thought war meant glory. Norman Jewison directs this heartfelt and powerful movie highlighted by one of the most poignant final scenes ever filmed - the family’s emotionally stirring, almost wordless visit to the Vietnam Veteran’s Memorial in Washington D.C. “In country” is the term American GI’s used for their time in Vietnam. Based on the novel by Bobbie Ann Mason.
